intro: Adenostemma lavenia var. microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
